H0.text: an object that moves around an external axis is said to be. Rotating

H1.text: an object that moves around an external axis is said to be. Circling

H2.text: an object that moves around an external axis is said to be. Revolving

H3.text: an object that moves around an external axis is said to be. orbit

A6.text: A rotation around an axis completely external to the moving body is called a revolution (or orbit), e.g. Earth's orbit around the Sun.

A7.text: revolution, often referred to as orbital revolution for clarity, is used when one body moves around another while rotation is used to mean the movement around an axis.

A8.text: orbit is the curved trajectory of an object under the influence of an attracting force.

A9.text: the object is then said to be orbiting the body.
